title: Report Says Biomass Is Not An Ingredient In A Sustainable Food Future
teaser: The researchers are slamming the widespread use and government promotion of biofuels as a way to reduce greenhouse gases.
contentencoded:
A new report out by the World Resources Institute slams the widespread use and government promotion of biofuels as a way to reduce greenhouse gases. The report is part of the institute’s series “Creating a Sustainable Food Future.”

Princeton research scholar Tim Searchinger is the primary author of the new report. He discusses the conclusions with Here & Now’s Lisa Mullins.

  • Read the report, “Avoiding Bioenergy Competition for Food Crops and Land”

Guest

  • Tim Searchinger, research scholar at Princeton’s Woodrow Wilson School and a senior fellow at the World Resources Institute.
